src.memory

Class MemoryAllocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.memory.MemoryAllocator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BF, FF, WF

    public class MemoryAllocator
extends Object

    The MemoryAllocator class serves as a skeleton for implementing memory allocation methods such as First Fit (FF), Best Fit (BF), and Worst Fit (WF).

    The MemoryAllocator class SHOULD NOT be instantiated. Instead, it should be extended. The class that extends the MemoryAllocator should obey the signature of the MemoryAllocator(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) constructor. The run() method contains a valid implementation and must not be overwritten. However, the run() method should be the only method called after instantiating this class. The allocateSlot(src.memory.Process) method contains no implementation and must be implemented by the extending class. If extending class fails to implement the allocateSlot(src.memory.Process) method, the run method will throw a UnsupportedOperationException.

    Because a memory allocating method algorithm depends heavily on the part when a memory slot is allocated to a process, the allocateSlot(src.memory.Process) method is provided for the extending class to implement. The allocateSlot(src.memory.Process) method should allocate a MemorySlot to the current Process and then return the MemorySlot that was allocated to the process. If the allocateSlot(src.memory.Process) method is not able to allocate a process, then null is returned. However, this is handle properly by the run() method.

    Author:
    Richard I. Zhunio

        protected LinkedList<MemorySlot> mList

    • Constructor Detail

      • MemoryAllocator

        protected MemoryAllocator(String memoryInput,
                          String processInput)
                   throws FileNotFoundException,
                          InvalidNumberException
        Creates a new MemoryAllocator.
        Parameters:
        memoryInput - the filepath to the Minput.data file.
        processInput - the filepath to the Pinput.data file.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the memoryInput or processInputdoes not contain a valid filepath.
        InvalidNumberException - if the Minput.data or Pinput.data contain invalid numbers.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public List<String> run()
        Runs the memory allocation method, and returns a list containing the the memory slots allocated and their corresponding processes.
        Returns:
        a list of memory slots and their corresponding allocated process.

      • allocateSlot

        protected MemorySlot allocateSlot(Process process)
        Allocates a Process to a MemorySlot if the MemorySlot has enough space available for the Process. If the MemorySlot does not have enough space available for the Process, the MemorySlot returned is null. Otherwise, the returned value contains the MemorySlot that allocates the Process.
        Parameters:
        process - the Process to allocate.
        Returns:
        the MemorySlot that allocates the process, otherwise null is returned.
